intro: Argylia australis, commonly known as the Australian argyle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in winter. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a rough texture. Argylia australis is typically found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
